page.title: 07GOVERNMENT OF CHAGFORD
page.content: The community of Chagford is ruled by a{Parish Council,}which consists of 12 members and a salaried{Clerk. }Every 4 years a new Council is voted in by parishoners over 18 years of age. The next election will be in 1987. The Council looks after all matters which affect the lives of parishoners. It keeps the{Jubilee Playing Field}in good condition and also the{Council seats. Local sports grounds used by the{Soccer, Cricket and Tennis Clubs } receive donations from the Council, as do other local organisations. Comments and criticisms received by the Council are passed on to the rele_ vant people in the hope of a solution being found. At{Christmas}time in the Square the Council organises various {festivities, decorations,etc. }Reports of Council meetings are displayed in the Square.
